name: Baked Scotch Eggs
author: Richard
summary: A baked version of the popular pub Scotch egg. No need to fry here. Comes out just as good as the fried version without the mess of frying. Serve hot with mustard of choice.
directions: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C)
Line a baking pan with aluminum foil
Place a wire rack over the foil
Cut and form pork sausage into 2-ounce patties
Place a hard-boiled egg in the center of each patty and press sausage around the egg
Beat raw egg in a small bowl
Place bread crumbs in another bowl
Dip each patty into the egg; roll in the bread crumbs to coat
Place coated patties on the wire rack
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 20 to 22 minutes
